channel.title: Pages on Syniti Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Syniti Documentation

item.title: Disposition
item.description: Disposition Use this page to: - [Register External Process Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_External_Process_Validations) - [Register Stored Procedure Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_Stored_Procedure_Validations) - [Register View Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_View_Validations) - [Run Interface Events Sequentially](../Use_Cases/Run_Interface_Events_Sequentially) To access this page, select Configuration > Disposition in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new dispositions or to edit delivered dispositions; the Automate code would need to be updated for the disposition to properly work. Field Description

item.title: Event Types
item.description: Event Types Use this page to: - [Register Interface Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Interface_Events) - [About Automate Events](../Use_Cases/About_Automate_Events) - [Register Stored Procedure Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Stored_Procedure_Events) - [Register WebApp Events](../Use_Cases/Register_WebApp_Events) - [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events) - [Copy Files from One Folder to Another](../Use_Cases/Copy_Files_from_One_Folder_to_Another) - [Set Up a Looping Process](../Use_Cases/Set_up_a_Looping_Process) To access this page, select Configuration > Event Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new event types or to edit the delivered event types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the event type to properly work.

item.title: File Format Types
item.description: File Format Types Use this page to [Add Logical Paths](../Use_Cases/Add_Logical_Paths). To access this page, select IO Config > File Modification Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new file modification types or to edit the delivered file modification types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the file modification type to properly work. Field Description FILE FORMAT

item.title: File Modification Types
item.description: File Modification Types Use this page to [Add Logical Paths](../Use_Cases/Add_Logical_Paths). To access this page, select IO Config > File Format Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new file modification types or to edit the delivered file modification types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the file modification type to properly work. Field Description FILE MODIFICATION

item.title: File Operations H
item.description: File Operations H File Operations V Use this page to: - [Add File Operations](../Use_Cases/Add_File_Operations) - [Set up a Looping Process](../Use_Cases/Set_up_a_Looping_Process) To access this page, select IO Config > File Operations in the Navigation pane. Field Description OPERATION Displays the name of the operation to be performed. LOGICAL PATH IN Displays the registered data source from which files are transferred.

item.title: History
item.description: History Use this page to [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface). To access this page, select History in the Navigation pane. Field Description INTERFACE ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the interface. INTERFACE Displays the name of the interface. COMMENT Displays a comment describing the interface. ACTIVE If checked, the interface has been tested and is ready to be run.

item.title: History (Chart)
item.description: History (Chart) Use this page to [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface). To access this page: Select History in the Navigation pane. Click the Chart icon to open for the desired interface. Field Description Daily Duration Displays how long the interface took to complete each day. Historical Duration Displays the average processing time for the interface to complete.

item.title: History (Detail) V
item.description: History (Detail) H History (Detail) V Use this page to [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface). To access this page: Select History in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Field Description INSTANCE ID Displays the ID of the instance that the interface ran against. TIME STARTED Displays the time that the interface started running.

item.title: History Failed (Detail) H
item.description: History Failed (Detail) H Use this page to [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface) . To access this page: Select History in the Navigation pane. Click the Failed icon for the desired interface. History Failed (Detail) V Field Description INSTANCE ID Displays the ID of the instance that the interface ran against. TIME STARTED Displays the time that the interface started running.

item.title: Interface Event (Validations) H
item.description: Interface Event (Validations) H Interface Event (Validations) V Use this page to: - [Register Interface Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_Interface_Validations) - [Run Interface Events Sequentially](../Use_Cases/Run_Interface_Events_Sequentially) - [Register External Process Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_External_Process_Validations) To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click the Validations icon for the desired event. Field Description VALIDATION ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the validation.

item.title: Interface Events H
item.description: Interface Events H Interface Events V Use this page to: - [Register Interface Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Interface_Events) - [Register Stored Procedure Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Stored_Procedure_Events) - [Register WebApp Events](../Use_Cases/Register_WebApp_Events) - [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events) - [Copy Files from One Folder to Another](../Use_Cases/Copy_Files_from_One_Folder_to_Another) - [Set Up a Looping Process](../Use_Cases/Set_up_a_Looping_Process) To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Field Description EVENT ID

item.title: Interface History H
item.description: Interface History H Interface History V Use this page to [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Field Description TIME STARTED Displays the time the interface started running. TIME COMPLETED Displays the time the interface finished running. MESSAGE Displays a message to indicate if the interface completed, failed or if there is an error.

item.title: Interface Validations H
item.description: Interface Validations H Interface Validations V Use this page to [Register Interface Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_Interface_Validations). To access this page: Select Interface in the Navigation pane. Click the Validations icon for the desired interface. Field Description VALIDATION ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the validation. PRIORITY Displays a value that determines the order in which the validation runs.

item.title: Interfaces H
item.description: Interfaces H Interfaces V Use this page to: - [Create an Interface](../Use_Cases/Create_an_Interface) - [Schedule Interfaces](../Use_Cases/Schedule_Interfaces) - [Activate Interfaces, Events and Validations](../Use_Cases/Activate_Interfaces_Events) - [Test Interfaces](../Use_Cases/Test_Interfaces) - [Schedule Interfaces](../Use_Cases/Schedule_Interfaces) - [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface) To access this page, select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Field Description GROUP Displays the name of the interface group. Interface groups are used to categorize interfaces. ORDER

item.title: Log H
item.description: Log H Log V Use this page to [View Logs for an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_Logs_for_an_Interface). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Click the Important icon to view the Log page filtered by tasks with a level set at Reporting by Importance Level or above. This icon is only enabled of there are tasks written to the log for the interface according to the level set in the Reporting by Importance Level field on the Parameters page.

item.title: Logging Modules
item.description: Logging Modules Use this page to [Add Logging Modules](../Use_Cases/Add_Logging_Modules). To access this page: Select Configuration > Parameters in the Navigation pane. Click the Modules icon. Field Description MODULE Displays the name of the logging module, which is a category of logs that displays information based on what types of errors are logged. SEVERITY Displays the severity level assigned to the task.

item.title: Logging Severities H
item.description: Logging Severities H Logging Severities V Use this page to [Configure Logging Severities](../Use_Cases/Configure_Logging_Severities). To access this page, select Configuration > Logging > Severities in the Navigation pane. Field Description PRIORITY Displays a number to indicate the logging severity. IMAGE Displays an image to indicate the type of logging severity. This image corresponds to the Image Name field on the Vertical View.

item.title: Logical Path (Instance) H
item.description: Logical Path (Instance) H Logical Path (Instance) V Use this page to [Add Logical Paths](../Use_Cases/Add_Logical_Paths). To access this page: Select IO Config > Logical Paths in the Navigation pane. Click the Instances icon for the desired logical path. Field Description INSTANCE Displays the environment name. NOTE: The instance configured must match the instance selected on the Automate Parameters page.

item.title: Logical Path Instance (Browse)
item.description: Logical Path Instance (Browse) Use this page to [Browse FTP Site or Path](../Use_Cases/Browse_FTP_Site_or_Path). To access this page: Select IO Config > Logical Paths in the Navigation pane. Click the Instances icon for the desired logical path. Click the Browse icon for the desired instance. Field Description T Displays a leaf icon to indicate the record is a file or displays a folder icon to indicate the record is a folder.

item.title: Logical Paths H
item.description: Logical Paths H Logical Paths V Use this page to [Add Logical Paths](../Use_Cases/Add_Logical_Paths). To access this page, select IO Config > Logical Paths in the Navigation pane. Field Description LOGICAL PATH Displays the file path of the folder or the FTP site. TRANSPORT TYPE Displays the type of file transport. Options are: Local – Local File System, which means the files are in folders to which the DSP can read/write.

item.title: Monitor (Events) H
item.description: Monitor (Events) H Monitor (Events) V Use this page to [Monitor Interfaces & Events](../Use_Cases/Monitor_Interfaces_Events). To access this page: Select Monitor in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Or Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane to monitor a single interface. Click Vertical View for the desired interface. Click the Monitor icon. Click the Events icon for the desired interface.

item.title: Monitor H
item.description: Monitor H Monitor V Use this page to [Monitor Interfaces & Events](../Use_Cases/Monitor_Interfaces_Events). To access this page, select Monitor in the Navigation pane. Field Description TIME STARTED Displays the time that the interface started running. INSTANCE ID Displays the ID of the instance that the interface ran against. INTERFACE Displays the name of the interface. EVENT ID

item.title: Parameters
item.description: Parameters Use this page to [Configure Automate Parameters](../Use_Cases/Configure_Automate_Parameters). To access this page, select Configuration > Parameters in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is recommended for only developers or system administrators to edit Automate parameters. Field Description Application Displays the name of the application: InterfaceServer. NOTE: Automate is formerly known as InterfaceServer. Application Version Displays the version number of the application. Database Version Displays the database version that the application is using.

item.title: Purpose
item.description: Purpose Use this page to: - [Register External Process Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_External_Process_Validations) - [Register Stored Procedure Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_Stored_Procedure_Validations) - [Register View Validations](../Use_Cases/Register_View_Validations) To access this page, select Configuration > Purpose in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new purposes or to edit the delivered purposes; the Automate code would need to be updated for the purpose to properly work. Field Description VALIDATION PURPOSE

item.title: Reports
item.description: Reports Use this page to access installed Automate reports. To access this page, select Reports from the Navigation pane. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the priority in which the Automate reports display. REPORT Displays the report available in Automate. Click to view the report.

item.title: Role (Instance)
item.description: Role (Instance) Use this page to [Assign Users to Roles](../Use_Cases/Assign_Users_to_Roles). To access this page: Select Configuration > Roles in the Navigation pane. Click the Users icon for the desired role. Field Description ROLE Displays the role to which the user is added. INSTANCE Displays the instance for the user. NOTE: The Instance selected MUST match the Instance field in 2 additional places for email notifications to properly work: the Parameterspage in Automate and the Parameters page in System Administration.

item.title: Roles
item.description: Roles Use this page to [Add Roles](../Use_Cases/Add_Roles). To access this page, select Configuration > Roles in the Navigation pane. Field Description ROLE Displays the name of the role. Automate is delivered with the Admin role. USERS Click to open the Role (Instance) page to assign users to roles. The count on the icon is the total number of users assigned to the selected role.

item.title: Stored Procedure
item.description: Stored Procedure Use this page to [Register Stored Procedure Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Stored_Procedure_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of StoredProcedure. Field Description Field Displays the field from the stored procedure view that is passed to the event.

item.title: Tasks
item.description: Tasks Use this page to [View History of an Interface](../Use_Cases/View_History_of_an_Interface). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the History icon for the desired interface. Click the Tasks icon for the desired interface run. Field Description TASK Displays the Task icon. NAME Displays the descriptive name of the tasks that has run for an interface.

item.title: Transport Types H
item.description: Transport Types H Transport Types V Use this page to [Add Logical Paths](../Use_Cases/Add_Logical_Paths). To access this page, select IO Config > Transport Types in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new transport types or to edit the delivered transport types; the Automate code would need to be updated for the transport type type to properly work. Field Description DEFAULT

item.title: UOM
item.description: UOM This page is used to: - [Set Retry Parameters](../Use_Cases/Set_Retry_Parameters) - [Run Interface Events Sequentially](../Use_Cases/Run_Interface_Events_Sequentially) - [Schedule Interfaces](../Use_Cases/Schedule_Interfaces) To access this page, select Configuration > UOM in the Navigation pane. NOTE: It is not recommended to add new UOMs or to edit the delivered UOMs; the Automate code would need to be updated for the UOM to properly work. Field Description UOM Displays the first letter of the unit of measure used to schedule an interface.

item.title: WebApp Event
item.description: WebApp Event Use this page to [Register WebApp Events](../Use_Cases/Register_WebApp_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of WebApp. Field Description FIELD Displays the field from the WebApp view that is passed to the event. When the view is registered to the event, the parameters are automatically created for the event.

item.title: Workflow
item.description: Workflow Use this page to [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon. Click the Parameters icon for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Field Description FIELD Displays the field from the workflow view that is passed to the event. When the view is registered to the event, the parameters are automatically created for the event.

item.title: Workflow (Email)
item.description: Workflow (Email) Use this page to [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click Vertical View for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Click the Fields icon. Field Description Interface ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the interface. Event ID Displays a system-generated ID to uniquely identify the event.

item.title: Workflow Links
item.description: Workflow Links Use this page to [Register Workflow Events](../Use_Cases/Register_Workflow_Events). To access this page: Select Interfaces in the Navigation pane. Click the Events icon for the desired interface. Click Vertical View for an event with EVENT TYPE of Workflow. Click the Links icon. NOTE: The Links icon is only enabled if the Link to Page ID field is populated. Field Description PRIORITY Displays the order in which the link appears in the workflow (if there are multiple links).
